meanings.definition: The practice or process of communicating by telegraph.
meanings.sent1: In the past, telegraphy was a common way to send messages quickly over long distances.
meanings.sent2: Telegraphy played a crucial role in connecting people across faraway places before modern technology.
meanings.sent3: I tried to learn telegraphy, but I kept sending messages to the wrong person by mistake!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like telegraphy, instantly conveying her happiness to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of telegraphy made it a revolutionary form of communication in its time.

meanings.definition: The technology or system of sending messages over long distances using coded signals.
meanings.sent1: The development of telegraphy revolutionized how people communicated across vast distances.
meanings.sent2: Telegraphy allowed for the rapid exchange of information between distant locations.
meanings.sent3: I felt like a secret agent using telegraphy to send coded messages to my friend.
meanings.sent4: His eyes were like telegraphy, silently transmitting his thoughts to me without a word spoken.
meanings.sent5: The efficiency of telegraphy made it a game-changer in the world of communication.
